title: MusicNews | Promoters issue statement on One Direction's cancelled Belfast gig
text:
If you've got a ticket for the remaining One Direction dates in Belfast tonight or tomorrow night, you might want to read the below statement issued by promoters.
As previously reported, the boyband cancelled their show at the 11th hour last night when Liam Payne suddenly took ill.
Although no details have been provided on what was actually wrong with the singer, he is now well enough to continue with the tour.
The statement read:
"Tonight’s and Tomorrow Night's One Direction concerts in SSE Arena, Belfast will be going ahead as planned.
Once again we apologise for the cancellation of last night’s One Direction show. We thank everyone for their understanding and their good wishes to Liam.
Tuesday’s concert has been rescheduled for this Friday 23rd October. All tickets from last night's postponed concert will be valid for Friday.
For anyone not able to attend the rescheduled Show on Friday, please contact point of purchase for detail of how to obtain a refund.
The SSE Arena Box Office
(028) 9073 9074
Ticketmaster Customer Services
importantnotice@ticketmaster.ie
We would also like to extend our sincere thanks to the Belfast Giants & Sheffield Steelers Ice Hockey Teams and fans for moving their Game on Friday."
